summary.para: Instructs data to be copied from the staging area to a writable CD.

param.name: hwnd
param.para: The handle of the parent window of the UI.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: The staging area has a default location of %userprofile%\Local Settings\Application Data\Microsoft\CD Burning. Its actual path can be retrieved through , , , , or by using the CSIDL_CDBURN_AREA value.

summary.para: Gets the drive letter of a CD drive that has been marked as write-enabled.

param.name: pszDrive
param.para: A pointer to a string containing the drive letter, for example "F:".

param.name: cch
param.para: The size of the string, in characters, pointed to by pszDrive. This value will normally be 4. Values larger than 4 are allowed, but the extra characters will be ignored by this method. Values less than 4 will generate an E_INVALIDARG error.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: The drive whose letter designation is returned by this method is the drive that has the Enable cd writing on this drive option selected. This option is found on the drive's property sheet. Only one drive on a system can have this option selected.
If a recordable CD drive is present but that option has been deselected, the method will return an error code.

summary.para: Scans the system for a CD drive with write-capability, returning TRUE if one is found.

param.name: pfHasRecorder
param.para: A pointer to a Boolean value containing TRUE if a suitable device is located, FALSE otherwise.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: This search does not rely on the state of the Enable cd writing on this drive option found on the drive's property sheet. Instead, the determination is based on IMAPI.

summary.para: Exposes methods that determine whether a system has hardware for writing to CD, the drive letter of a CD writer device, and programmatically initiate a CD writing session.
